All Classes

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AboutMenu
    Class that represents the about screen of the game.
    Button
    Class that represents each button of the game.
    Car
    Class that represents a Car, which is the main actor of the game.
    CarSelector
    Class that represents a CarSelector, used to choose among cars in SettingsMenu.
    CategoriesMenu
    Class that represents the information window of the game.
    ChartCreator
    Write a description of class Charts here.
    Crossing
    Class that represents the pedestrian crossing.
    ExplanatoryGIF
    Class that represents the explanatory GIF image, whose instances are contained to every instance of InformationWindow class.
    GifImage
    This class can be used to read animated gif image files and extract the individual images of the animation sequence.
    InfoMessage
    The InfoMessage is used to display results on the screen.
    InformationWindow
    Class that represents the information window of the game.
    Language
    Class that holds the game's language data.
    LanguageSelector
    Class that represents a LanguageSelector, used to choose between languages.
    LiveBoard
    The LiveBoard is used to display remaining lives on the screen.
    Lives
    Class that holds the game's data about available lives.
    MainMenu
    Write a description of class MainMenu here.
    MyWorld
    World of every level.
    OtherCar
    Class that represents a Car, which is autocontrolled.
    Pedestrian
    Class that represents the pedestrian, whose instances are contained to some (or all) instances of Crossing class.
    Road
    Class that represents the (vertical) Road.
    Score
    Class that holds the game's data about scores.
    ScoreBoard
    The ScoreBoard is used to display results on the screen.
    Selector
    Abstract class that represents a selector, mainly used for Language selector and car selector in this version of the game.
    Settings
    Class that holds the game's data about settings.
    SettingsMenu
    Class that represents the settings menu of the game.
    SmoothMover
    A variation of an actor that maintains precise location (using doubles for the co-ordinates instead of ints).
    Sound
    Class that holds the game's data about sound.
    SpeedLimitRange
    Class that represents the speed limit range.
    Speedometer
    The Speedometer is used to display the main actor's speed on the screen.
    SpeedSign
    Class that represents the speed sign.
    Statistics
    Class that holds the game's data about statistics.
    StatisticsMenu
    Class that represents the statistics window of the game.
    StopSign
    Class that represents the stop sign.
    SWorld
    SWorld is a super-class for a scrolling world (horizontal, vertical, or both).

    Author: danpost
    Version: May 22, 2016 (v2.1)

    To implement this super-class: (1) create a sub-class of this class (2) use a super(....) call to one of the constructors in this class (3) create the main actor (one that always stays in view) and call the setMainActor method
    NOTE: if placing the main actor to a location where scrolling will end up taking place before moving it, place a call the the 'act' method of this class at the end of the constructor of its subclass using 'super.act();'

    (4) (optional) set a scrolling background image using a call to setScrollingBackground or fillScrollingBackground
    NOTE: the order of steps above is very important

    There are two methods to add other objects into the world: the standard method addObject(Actor, int, int) can be used to add a scrollable actor into the world a secondary method addObject(Actor, int, int, boolean) which is equivalent to the standard method, except that the boolean will indicate the scrollable state of the object. The width and height dimensions for both the world and the universe of scenarios with a cell size greater than one will be raised to the nearest odd values to center the main actor.

    SPECIAL NOTE: if you decide to override the 'act' method of this class with an 'act' method in your sub-world, you will need to follow the format below to run the scrolling of the scenario:
    TimeBoard
    The TimeBoard is used to display remaining time & lives on the screen.
    TrafficLight
    Class that represents the traffic light.
    Vector
    A 2D vector.
    WarningMessage
    The WarningMessage is used to display warnings on the screen.
